content.text: MSCI has decided to quadruple the weighting of Chinese stocks included in its flagship Emerging Markets Index . Investors should n't take this as an invitation to pile into China without thinking . The index industry giant 's original 2017 move to include some so-called A-shares came with plenty of fanfare . In practice , emerging markets investors who benchmark their performance against MSCI 's index were safely able to ignore the move . Initial weightings meant Chinese shares made up less than 1 % of the EM index , slightly below ...
